Package slogo.compiler

Class GroupHelper

java.lang.Object
slogo.compiler.GroupHelper
public class GroupHelper
extends java.lang.Object
This class reads from a properties file to determine how to handle extra parameters for a given command. The "types" of commands are as follows: 1. Stackable: command calls should be stacked one after the other using the appropriate number of parameters each time. An error should be thrown if an incorrect multiple of parameters is given. Examples: fd 20 30 40 becomes fd 20 fd 30 fd 40, and towards 10 10 20 20 becomes towards 10 10 towards 20 20 2. Nestable: command calls should be nested in one another so the parameters are all 'computed' at once. Examples: sum 10 20 30 becomes sum sum 10 20 30, and and 10 20 30 becomes and and 10 20 30 3. No parameter: any parameters given should be ignored. Examples: pd, pi, turtles 4. Equal: the Equal command is a special case. In order to correctly return whether all parameters given are equal, Equal must be run on every pair of parameters, and all of these results must be And'ed together 5. NotEqual: the NotEqual command is also a special case. In order to correctly return whether all parameters given are not equal, NotEqual must be run on every pair of parameters, and all of these results must be Or'ed together

  • Method Details

    • createGroupFunction

      public SLogoFunction createGroupFunction() throws SLogoException
      Creates a SLogoFunction out of a list of Tokens depending on how the initial command handles multiple parameters. Uses reflection to call a private method read from a properties file.
      Returns:
      - a function that produces the result of running the command with multiple parameters
      Throws:
      SLogoException - - if command type is not recognized
